name: Sunset Jamaica Grande Resort

reviews.text: They had spotless washrooms everywhere. No waiting in a line to use the washroom and plenty of them at every turn.
reviews.title: A Relaxing and Fun Trip
Amazing resort

Friend had her Wedding there and it was absolutely breath taking. The Minister was very professional and the video and Wedding pictures turned out beautiful.
reviews.title: was an ok resort

likes.liked: — the people, the pools and the scenery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read a lot of the reviews on here after booking Sunset Jamaica Grande for our honeymoon - we started to get a little bit worried as there was a wide range of reviews. We stayed from 24th July-7th August.
reviews.title: We loved it

reviews.text: The journey from the airport is 2 1/2 hours but we knew that it would be so you can't really complain. The roads are bumpy yes but this isn't SJG's fault - it is supposed to be ready for the cricket world cup next year but they are now doubtful whether it will be.
reviews.title: Bring Earplugs

reviews.text: Now to the hotel - we were on our honeymoon so it's likely that we were going to have a good time anyway. The lobby is very modern and spacious and we were welcomed with rum punch (the first of many) and served very quickly.
reviews.title: Pros & Cons

likes.liked: — Size of the resort & centrally located for our activities
likes.disliked: — The annoying staff and lack of friendliness

reviews.title: Above average...
reviews.text: I had emailed and asked if possible for a cabana room - we were given one on the 2nd floor (there are only two floors in the cabanas) and we looked over Ocho, the beach and the ocean.
Pros
reviews.title: Wedding from HELL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at SJG 06/07-13/07 and we had an amazing time! When we arrived the front desk didn't have our reservation on file, but we were quickly reassured that it was "No problem". They dealt with the issue, and upgraded us to an oceanview room, from resort view, because it was our honeymoon. The rooms are o.k. not as great as everything else was.
reviews.title: No problem mon!
Sunset Jamaica Grande - only a 3 star resort but we still had a great time
reviews.text: All the staff were great, and very friendly. If you had a smile to give, you always got a smile and a greeting in return........ from maintanance...to management. The atmoshpere from lobby to restaurants was...casual, relaxed...but professional. I thought the resort was run very well. Everywhere you went there were people cleaning...picking garbage from the beach...cleaning light fixtures....scrubbing pillars etc. We wanted to use the hot tub at 4:30am and asked a security guard if we could and he laughed at us and said "No problem ....this is Jamaica mon." Essentially that's what we got all week...NO PROBLEM MON. Any request we had.

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: The food was better than expected for an AI. The buffet restaurant was better certain days than others...but overall pretty good. The a la carte restaurants were fabulous. Ginger Lily and La Diva were 5*, great meals, great service, great ambiance. The beach grill restaurant in the evening(can't remember what it's called) is also good. We ate at the beach grills during the day as well as late night (good burgers). I particularly liked Jamalicious cafe. The beef patties are awesome, and same with the service. We never had to wait too long for anything anywhere on the resort.

The beaches... great. The water ...warm. The drinks.... plenty and strong. We are not really pool swimmer so we didn't use them much, but they are beautiful...especially at night. I didn't see a mosquito....or any other bug for that matter....all week. We didn't get to do much water sports. The beginning of the week was nice weather and we did excursions, then the last part of the week when we were on the resort more it was windy and rainy. They closed water sports for this reason. Not the hotel's fault.
reviews.title: Loved Jamacia
Great fun, lots to do.
reviews.text: We took the Dunns River shuttle from the hotel and joined a group there. Great fun...just make sure you don't have any large unfit people behind you dragging you down. We did the Chukka Nine Mile Jeep safari tour.....a definate must! and the Chukka White River Tubing and the JT Dolphin Cove and Treasure Reef tours.....also a must.

reviews.title: Loved Sunset Grande
reviews.text: Although our trip from the airport to and from was a nightmare, we found the Hotel Sunset Grande to be outstanding in all respects.

The staff was extrememly helpful courteous, friendly, knowlegable, and professional. The facilities were extremely clean, food was outstanding, and activities were fun. We found the hotel very relaxing and accomodating.
reviews.title: Ya Mon Jamaica is grand!
Where is the Jamaican food?
reviews.text: Our apple rep. Glenn was also very helpful and also enchanced our stay. The tours were alot of fun, and tour guides also knowledgeable.

reviews.title: Had A Good Time
reviews.text: I would however, suggest a satellite dish, for the TV challenged, like me. 3 tv channels with New Jersey news just doesn't make it for me.

The only other thing that we didn't like, which really didn't have anything to do with the hotel, but in to the town, was the barrage of taxi and vendors. They made every trip into town difficult and uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Great Vacation!! Well worth the Value

reviews.text: will write in note form
reviews.title: great vacation

reviews.text: -stayed at the sunset Jan 14 to Jan 28, 2006
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: -no longer any construction except about 5% (unnoticable).
reviews.title: Relaxing Holiday
Take me back!!!
reviews.text: -every monday at 5:30pm there is welcome night at the north beach. (small buffet)

reviews.title: Great Resort if you're traveling on a budget
reviews.text: -no shade on the beach for those looking for it.

Spent a week at the new Grande, was different and alot of changes, the front desk was slow and the bus ride from the airport was very long and awful. The new front greeting area had alot of changes and frankly I missed the old front desk area, very modern this time, prefer the old, but the room was nice and very clean, housekeeping was excellent to us. The dining room was another story, we waited for over 1/2 hr for water and only two servers ask us if we would care for a drink. The pools were very nice and clean and very pretty at night. The night life has slowed down alot from past trips, and preferred the old way again. The entertainment was better two years ago and you could join in the dancing etc. But all in all, we still all agree the Grande is the place to stay in Ocho Rios and if you go hungry it is your own fault, the food was excellent and the grills were awesome !!! The bartenders were not as friendly as they use to be, either were the servers, we understand they are there to work, but a lil chat and friendly smile would have been nice. I did tell one of the supervisors if you are not friendly like all Jamaicans are, than noone will want to return right ? He agreed as he never even stopped to see why I made the remark. Guess they are not as friendly as they use to be !!! But still will stay there again, and enjoyed Ocho Rios as always. The shopping, The Ruins for lunch is a good outing and beautiful pictures, but the next time will visit there at night when all lit up. All in all, it is the grande for us and the one place you know you will get your money worth and have a nice time. Again Please bring back some of the old, and more of the smiles you use to have !!!! Other than that the place to stay in Ocho Rios !!!!
reviews.title: Still luv the grande !!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the SJG for 2 weeks from July 3rd to July 17th 2006 and had a fantastic time and great weather as well. After reading many poor reviews we were a bit apprehensive and decided to go with a complete neutral view. My suggestion to you is to take each Tripadviser review with a pinch of salt and remember that - different folks, different strokes!!
reviews.title: Great family resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's my view negative and positive. They are what I thought of the complex and are my honest opinions.
reviews.title: Grand Time at the Sunset Jamaica Grande

likes.liked: — The atmosphere and the amazing views, and good food.

reviews.title: Ripped Off and not to be trusted
reviews.text: RJG is not a 5 star hotel but as long as you know that before you go you will not be disappointed. I would class the complex as moving from 4 star to 3 star depending on where exactly you are within it. It is a family resort so if you don't like children, then I suggest you dont go here.The bedrooms and bathrooms are smallish but adequate and very clean and always stocked with shampoo, gells, etc, and always clean fresh towels. We saw no insects the whole time we were there. We stayed in the North Tower. If you're a person who goes to bed before 11pm then request the South Tower as you will hear the entertainment. After 11pm the music stops and everything goes nice and quiet. General stuff!

The coach journey took us 1h hour and 50 minutes and was not dangerous in anyway, however we left Montega Bay at 6.15pm so this might have made our journey quicker as the roads are under construction as I'm sure during the daytime there would maybe be delays with construction machinery. The check in at the hotel was fast, effecient and friendly,,, We had pre-requested a room in the South Tower because of Trip Adviser reports but ended up in the North Tower where we stayed for the whole holiday by choice as it was more convenient to everything for the kids and in General.
reviews.title: Oh So Grande

likes.disliked: — There should be a pool bar reserve for adults

reviews.text: We were on a cruise docked in Ocho Rios for the day and went to the Sunset Jamaica Grande on our own since we found out that they sell day passes to cruise ship passengers (not cheap - $130 for 2 adults + 2 small kids). It is a fairly nice resort with 5 pools (although they were too cold even on an 85 degree day), plenty of lounge chairs, decent bathrooms, and an attractive lobby, although the elevator to the pool was broken. We did not stay a night at the hotel so we didn't see the rooms. The resort is all-inclusive, so the day pass included food and drinks at the pool bar and grill, which were AWFUL. We couldn't choke down our food and even the drinks tasted funny. The resort had a decent beach and non-motorized watersports (kayak, paddle boat, etc. were included, which was nice). Overall, not luxurious, but fine for a beach/pool day.
reviews.title: Okay pools, bad food

reviews.text: I stayed at Sunset for two weeks, from Jan 19-Feb 3.
reviews.title: Loved every minute of it!

likes.disliked: — male staff was constantly coming on to us.

reviews.title: 3-star experience: lack of Jamaican flavor
reviews.text: I've travelled quite a bit around the world, and stayed at many different hotels/places. My advice to all the whiners is "vacation is what YOU make of it" and "don't be a crab, you're on vacation".

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, here is my humble perspective of the hotel:
reviews.title: sunset not so grande

likes.liked: — most of the staff were very helpfull and well trained
likes.disliked: — food was poor , always running out of drink , some staff were rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in and checkout were very fast. The hotel is beautiful, I loved the open terrace in the main lobby and the South Beach Grill. The hotel is VERY clean, and you always see workers cleaning.
reviews.title: very nice hotel. good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Air Jamaica flight was fine! People were friendly at the airport but we waited in a bus for 45 minutes until the driver had filled the bus. He told us it would take 2 hours to get to the resort but it actually took 3 hours. At the resort, we waited awhile to get checked in. They didn't have the ocean front room that we had booked but gave us a cabana instead. It was cabana 117 and it was very nice to have the patio right outside the sliding glass door. It was near the beach and a wonderful view! We were near everything---the pools, restaurants, main lobby, South Beach Bar and Grill. The room wasn't anything spectacular but it did have a TV that worked just fine. We did get to see a wedding at the Gazebo right outside our cabana. That was fun! The weather was great compared to winter weather here in Chicago! The trip back on the bus was much better. The driver stopped at one other resort and waited for 4 passengers that never did show up. Thank goodness he didn't wait too long. The ride to the airport was still 2 1/2 hours.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel hated the bus ride

likes.disliked: — The bus trip, there and back

reviews.text: this was the 2nd time going to this hotel. we got marrage there 5 years ago , but the hotel has change alot they have knock all the jamaica out of the hotel. well not go back again.
reviews.title: knock the jamaica out of the hotel
We had a blast
reviews.text: Me, my husband and our 2 year old son stayed there Jan 20-27.

reviews.title: SJG nice hotel Don't beleive the hype
reviews.text: We were impressed by everything there. We are spoiled by Hilton resort in Hawaii and New York restaurants and clubs(for those who are wondering what kind of ppl we are)

reviews.title: Totally Awesome!
reviews.text: JAMAICA, AIRPORT, CUSTOMS,TRANSFER TO HOTEL: as soon as you get off the plain-they did nto have AC(only fans) so it is hot there...The pasport control had long lines, but pasengers w/kids were given priorities and it was fast for us:-) The customs were fast too. The bus ride is long(at least 2 hours) but our driver was unbelievable-he was like a tour guide. he stopped once for 10 minutes and he was speeding a bit for us:-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a wonderful time here on our honeymoon in Oct/Nov 2005. The room was a decent size and the bed was comfortable. Things were pretty quiet on our floor aside from the day that there was a wedding, and the couple and their guests were all staying in the few rooms across the hall from us. That was a little hectic ... but it reminded us of our own wedding, so we were happy to just slip off to the beach and nap there instead! I was a bit nervous about the "all-inclusive" aspect ... where my husband loves seafood and spicy stuff, I am more of a picky/boring eater. But there were enough choices at the buffets each day for both of us to be very happy. Everything was made fresh and constantly refilled, as well, so nothing had that sort of greasy buffet taste to it! We also tried two of the resort's restaurants and were impressed (the Italian was EXCELLENT and the Asian cuisine was also very good). The piano bar was a nice place to just sit and have some drinks ... or to occasionally sing along! The staff was very friendly and the entertainment staff was a lot of fun! The elevators may have been the slowest elevators that ever existed ... but why should you be
reviews.title: Had an amazing honeymoon here!

likes.liked: — The fun staff and the food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in a hurry on vacation?! The beach was adequate size and very clean ... there were plenty of lounge chairs, as well. The open-air lobby is a lovely place to sit and chat and enjoy the fresh air. The one night we went to the dance club it was a little early and fairly empty, but I was admittedly too tipsy to stay very long, so I didn't see if many people showed up! There was some construction happening while we were there ... luckily not near our room. No vacation is perfect, though ... and the few quirks we encountered with this place were far outdone by all of the fun we had! We are actually of thinking of going back for our one year anniversary!
reviews.title: The Truman Show

likes.liked: — South Beach Bar - Having a drink during sunset.
likes.disliked: — Boring at night - would be better if not all-inclusive and you ate off-property

reviews.text: Firstly, I had never been to an all-inclusive hotel, or the Caribbean before, but I found the whole experience to be like living in the film TheTruman Show. It’s like a false reality planted into the middle of a beautiful, but impoverished Island. I & my wife spent 14 nights on honeymoon at the Jamaica Grande, from 26th June – 10th July 2006.
reviews.title: Great resort for city fun and excursions
A little taste of paradise does you good...
reviews.text: Can I also add that some of the reviews here appear to be written by either employees bigging themselves up, or hotel management.
GETTING THERE
reviews.title: Best Hotel Staff
nice get away
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I spent a week at Sunset Jamaica Grand from Jan. 14, 2006- Jan. 21, 2006. We are in our early thirties. We had a great time. Pros of the resort are the service, cleanliness, food and pools. The cons are the elevator service, beach and ride from airport. The staff at the resort are friendly and professional. The guys at the water sports are accomadating. The wait staff is attentive. The food at the three specialty reasturants is very good. I would say the Italian reasturant was the best, the Carribean reasturant and Asian resturants were also enjoyable. Make your reservations upon arrival. They book quickly. The buffet reasturant for breakfast, lunch and dinner were also superisingly good. The food was the best we every had at an all inclusive resort. The alcoholic drinks can be on the weak side but are tasty. The elevators ran very slowly. 1 of 3 was not working for almost the entire week. Even when it was working it was slow. If your room is on the third floor or higher you need to plan your day so you don't have to use the elevator too often. Some advice, request a room in the south tower. The north tower is still under construction. The pools at the resort are very nice but the beach was not. The beaches are small and not what we expected. The water was murky. Water sports were still fun, but not a typical caribbean beach. Be prepared for a 2 hour bus ride from the airport to the resort. Our plan landed at 12:30pm and we did not get to the resort until 5:30pm. The bus companies wait for the bus to fill up until they will leave the airport. Once you arrive at the resort you will forget the exhuasting ride. The resort is in walking distance to the town of Ocho Rios which was convenient for shopping. Do not forget to bargin with the locals. We went on 3 excursions and recommend all 3. Horseback riding in the ocean, Cool Runnings with Dunn river falls, and the Canopy tour. All were worth the trip. The locals in Ochos Rios town were not so bad. We expected to be constantly solicited but were not. Also do not depend on a wake up call they never called, there was an alarm clock in the room. At high usage times the shower might be cool. We did loose power and water for a couple minutes but both instances were corrected quickly. But it was "no problem mon." Your in Jamacia. Hope you have a great time.

Just returned from SGJ on the 22nd of Jan. It was wonderful. I really don't know why some people thought that it was soooo bad. The people were just wonderful and tried really hard to please you. They moved us to another room with a smile. The food was just great. We never had one bad meal. The staff had a smile on all time. Last year we visited the Dominican Republic. There is no comparison. If the people that thought this was a horrible place to stay should have visited there first and then they would appreciate this resort.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!!
Great Time!
reviews.text: Last week I took a group to the Sunset Jamaica Grande. It looks wonderful. Everyone had a wonderful time!

reviews.title: A good vacation....
reviews.text: We will start with the Great!

reviews.title: What a fun time at SJGR!
reviews.text: The restaurants had wonderful food. Breakfast is buffet. The choices are plentiful. Lunch is either buffet or there are two grills and one Cafe. Dinner is either buffet or there are three Gourmet Restaurants. All are delicious! If you like spicy try the Thai Curried Chicken at the Ginger Lily. Reservations can be made anytime so make all reservations on arrival at the Guest Services Desk.

reviews.title: Great Vacation
reviews.text: Was at the Grande from Jan 27 thru Feb 3 and had a great time.The ride over was long ( 2 1/2 hrs) and bumpy (their roads are terrible)but once we arrived it was great.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, had a fab time
reviews.text: The beach was great except for a couple of times the water had a oil slick on it and the air smelled from diesel fuel. I guess this is from the cruise ships that come in daily, but this happened only one time all week.

reviews.title: WOW! AWESOME!
reviews.text: The pools are beautiful to look at but a litte cool.

The resturants were pretty good, the beach grill was the best with ribeye steak (ask for two,they are small)and great service.Make sure if you go to the Italian resturant you wear long pants, we were refused entrance because we were in shorts.The chinese was okay but the service was slow.
reviews.title: The worst beach and view, plastic glasses and no ashtrays!
Great Place
reviews.text: Rooms were okay, eveything functioned properly and the they were clean. We had double beds in our room and they seem small and short.

We stayed at SJG from 18/06-25/06 had a fanastic time - It was just my husband and myself (celebrating my 40th birthday) and have already decided will be taking the kids next year (we have 3 teenagers and there is definately plenty to keep them occupied) All those of you that say it is definately not 5 star I beg to differ - Have stayed 5 star riu etc and this was much better!! DONT BELIEVE THE REVIEWS!! !
reviews.title: yeah man SJG no problem!!!
No doubt, I'll go back
reviews.text: Yes the rooms could do with updating and we may have waited a while for a lift occasionally but no way did any one ever wait half an hour that is such an exageration (they should try waiting for a lift at a hotel in vegas - that is a long wait!!) and we werent there to sit in our room all day - they were clean and comfortable and that is all that matters!

reviews.title: Excellent vacation
reviews.text: The speciality restaurants are fantastic - especially the South Beach Grill which was our favourite we had no trouble booking in to them. Dont book for a Tuesday as you will miss the Beach Party the effort the staff put in is superb - yes if you want to queue for sugar cane the queue was quite long but it did die down later on in the night so people could have gone back!! We only really used the buffet for breakfast (queues at peak times but not too long) We used Grills and Jamalicious at lunch time/late afternoon. The staff are friendly and welcoming - nothing too much trouble! Plenty of choice of bars - We used to start off at the North Bar and work our way back across to the south tower stopping at each bar!! Drinks excellent!! Lived on Pina Colada and my Husband liked the Rum Creams - I could go on forever!! Pools are all lovely there is entertainment at main pool so was quite lively but south pool was lovely and relaxing - Beach was lovely and clean also sea was clear and warm as bath water (did not see any oil etc and there were 3 ships in while we were there) Make sure you do Cool Runnings to Dunn River Falls - we had an excellent time. Bob Marley trip was a great experience as well!! (dont bother with church or Jerk Station if you can help it tho!)

reviews.title: so much fun!!!
reviews.text: A group of 17 of us went to SJG for 7 nights. We had a ball. Great family place. The kids couldn't ask for more. We went horse back riding on the beach, Kayaking, Parasailing, and Jet Skiing, Trapolining in the ocean, Climbed the falls at Dunn’s River, we toured a plantation, shopped, karaoke at the hotel at night, went to local clubs at night, especially Margaritville and chilled by the pool when we wanted to rested. We had a great time. I rooms are okay and had one or two problems but this did not interrupt the vacation. We also saw several weddings there and they were beautifully done. The food was good especially the local food at breakfast and dinner. Rundown, Ackee, Snapper, yams, bammy, etc. Don't forget your WATER SHOES, it help to have one for the water sports and other activites. I bought $400.00 in cash and came back with some still in my pocket. Management will try to accommodate you, so make sure you call about any problems. I plan to go back in the future.

reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!
reviews.text: My sister, my husband and I stayed at the Sunset Grande from July 3, until July 7. Let me tell you, we did not expect that vacation to be as nice as it turned out to be. From the time, we landed at the airport, we were having fun. True, the line was long at custom, but it went fairly fast for us. We did not even notice the 2 hr trip to the hotel, because we were so busy listening to the tour guide and looking from left to right. When we arrived a the hotel, we were treated like royalty with music, drink and a nice "Welcome to Jamaica".

description: Escape to the all-inclusive splendor of the legendary 730-room Sunset Jamaica Grande Resort in Ocho Rios with its spectacular variety of amenities, divine dining, spa and stellar location. A beautiful white-sand beach fringes the resort while five lavish pools meander through this beachside complex, featuring waterfalls, plunge pools, Jacuzzis, swaying rope bridge and swim-up bars. Amenities include five restaurants, two beach grills, eight bars, two kids clubs, non-motorized water sports, full-service spa, air-conditioned fitness center, tennis, mini casino, nightly entertainment, disco, shops, business center, conference facilities, weddings and much more. Services abound, offering the ideal getaway for singles, couples, families and groups. The sensational Lighthouse Waterslide opened in April 2007.
